current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Truth in Lending Act to provide that residential mortgage loans held in portfolio
			 qualify as qualified mortgages for purposes of the presumption of the
			 ability to repay requirements under such Act, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 129C(b)(2) of the Truth in Lending Act

header.#text: Loans held on portfolio treated as qualified mortgages

quote.#tail:
includes a residential mortgage loan made by a creditor having less than $10,000,000,000 in total
			 assets so long as such loan appears on the
			 balance sheet of such creditor.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2641 IS: To amend the Truth in Lending Act to provide that residential mortgage loans held in portfolio qualify as qualified mortgages for purposes of the presumption of the ability to repay requirements under such Act, and for other purposes.
